content.rendered:
Enchanting Orissa Tour Package

Home » India » Orissa » Enchanting Orissa Tour Package

Tour Overview

Odisha, the land of paddy fields and palm-fringed silver beaches, temples, rivers, waterfalls, and tribal people, has a plethora of major attractions, including the Bhubaneswar and Puri temples, miles of clean beaches, and the magnificent Sun Temple of Konark. Justifying the exceptional, peaceful, and serene eastern part of India as a travel destination for those wishing to see the elements that contribute to the country’s uniqueness.

Odisha, which is bordered by the Bay of Bengal on the east, is a lesser-known beach destination that should no longer be kept a secret. Odisha, home to a plethora of Hindu temples and, surprisingly, Buddhist shrines, is a tourism destination that transports you to Ashoka the Great’s glorious time. This 6 days / 5 nights tour would be covering all the best spots planned.

Enchanting Orissa Tour Itinerary Package

Day 1 :Arrival at Bhubaneswar

Welcome to Bhubaneswar, You are greeted on arrival at Bhubaneswar airport/railway station by Namaste India Trip representative and transfer to hotel. Later if time permit half day sightseeing of famous city temples including Raja Rani, Parsurameswar, Mukteshwar (Gem of Orissa architecture), & Lingaraj (it is the biggest temple in Bhubaneswar). Overnight at Bhubaneswar.

Day 2 :Bhubaneswar – Dhauli – Hirapur – Pipli – Konark – Puri

Morning visit to Khandagiri & Udayagiri Jain Caves (oldest rock cut Caves, the caves are reminiscent of the influence of Buddhism and Jainism in Orissa). Then drive to Puri en route visit Dhauli (Buddhist Stupa/ peace pagoda), Pipli (the appliqué work village). And visit the Sun temple (one of the world famous heritage site & famously known as Black Pagoda). Enroute visit to Ramachandi Temple & Chandrabhaga beach (one of the finest beaches with a long stretch of clean sands & the beach has its own lovely serenity). Return back to Puri. Relax on the golden beach of Puri. Overnight at Puri.

Day 3 :Puri – Chilika

Morning drive to Chilika lake at Barkul (the largest Ramsar site of Asia and famous for its migratory birds coming from distance places). Take the boat cruise to visit the temple island, birds island at Nalabana. Relax at the Lakeside cottage. Overnight at Chilika.

Day 4 :Chilika – Taptapani

The morning after breakfast drive to Tapta Pani en route visit Taratarini temple (the legendary temple on the hillock). Also, visit Silk city Berhampur to find the SILK Saree on your own choice. Later proceed to Taptapani. Overnight at the Hill Resort.

Day 5 :Taptapani – Chandragiri (Tibetan Camp) – Gopalpur

Morning has a Sulphur bath at Taptapani then post breakfast you can visit Tibetan settlement at Chandragiri to explore the new world Amidst of natural forest.

Chandragiri with rare scenic beauty, which presents a picturesque landscape, is a paradise for all nature lovers. Surrounded by luxuriant tropical forest, gurgling rivers, exquisite mountain slopes and roaring hilltops this exotic place of Orissa is widely known for the Tibetan refugee colony, where immigrants from Tibet have been rehabilitated. Bestowed with bounties of nature, this place is famous for seasonal fruits, Tibetan woolen garments, carpets and dogs of various breeds. The large-scale horticulture plantations, as well as the cultural activities of the Tibetan refugees, make this place more colorful and attractive. This hillside settlement of Tibetans, which is also an ideal health resort, attracts both domestic and foreign tourists from far and wide for its pleasant ambience. Tibetan spiritual leader and by His Holiness Dalai Lama to inaugurate Buddhist monastery at Chandragiri in Orissa’s on 12 Jan 2010.

Visit the Padmasambhava and University. Have lunch over there and later drive back to Gopalpur on Sea.

Day 6 :Departure from Bhubaneswar

Today a Bid farewell of Exotic Odisha tour, after breakfast transfer to Airport/ Railway Station for the onward journey.

Price Details

Tour Name Orissa Travel Package
Duration 6 Days / 5 Nights
Destinations Bhubaneshwar – Konark – Puri – Chilika – Gopalpur – Chandragiri
Tour Price On Request

    Trip Highlights

    • Visit to the famous Lingaraj Temple Bhubaneswar
    • The famous Konark Sun temple tour
    • The Jagannath Temple Puri Darshan
    • Morning drive to the Chilika Lake, the largest lake for migratory birds
    • Enjoy the boat cruise to the birds and temple island, Nalabana
    • Visit to Taptapani famous for the sulphur bath
    • Visit to the Chandragiri Tibetan Camp
    • Padmasambhava and Lunch
    • Gopalpur on sea

    Package Inclusions

    • All car / taxi / cab service
    • Accommodation as per itinerary
    • Meals as per itinerary
    • Driver allowance, parking fees, fuel charges
    • Pick up and drop off service

    Package Exclusions

    • Medical and travel insurance
    • Any expense of personal nature
    • Monument entrance fees
    • Tipping, phone bills, etc.
    • Anything not mentioned in the inclusions section

    FAQs - Enchanting Orissa Tour Package

    Q. Why Is Odisha Famous For Tourism?

    A. Odisha is well-known for its heritage sites and stunning scenery. From beaches to pilgrimage sites, Odisha offers visitors from all over the world a plethora of sightseeing opportunities. Furthermore, each year, the Puri Beach Festival and the Jagannath Rath Yatra attract a large number of tourists to Odisha.

    Q. When Is The Best Time To Travel To Orissa?

    A. Winter is the best time to visit Odisha because of the pleasant weather. The weather draws a large number of visitors, kicking off the high season. Odisha in winter means quiet nights alone with the gift of clear blue skies above.

    Q. What Is Orissa’s Most Famous Sweet?

    A. The Chhena Gaja is a popular sweet in the state of Odisha. Though the base of this native sweet, like rasagolla and Chhena Poda, is Chhena or farmer’s cheese, it tastes completely different.

    Q. What Makes Odisha The “Best Kept Secret”?

    A. Odisha, India’s most beautiful state, is billed as the country’s best-kept tourism secret. If you’ve ever been to Odisha, you’ll know that it’s a land of cathartic spiritual experiences and timeless architecture. Odisha also has a rich artistic heritage.

    Q. Why Is It Known As Odisha’s Golden Triangle?

    A. Golden Triangle Odisha is a popular tourist destination in this state. Bhubaneswar, Konark, and Puri are three iconic places in Odisha, each with their own significance, but together they form the Golden Triangle of Odisha.
